**INSTITUTION
Discharge Summary
Name :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]

**ID-NUM

Admitted :
**DATE[Mar 12 2007]
Discharged :
**DATE[Mar 30 2007]
Dict :
**NAME[XXX , WWW]
Attend :
**NAME[ZZZ , YYY]
DEATH SUMMARY
DATE OF DEATH :
**DATE[Mar 31 2007] .
CAUSE OF DEATH :
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , end stage .
BRIEF HOSPICE COURSE :
Ms. **NAME[AAA] was an **AGE[in 80s]- year - old female who was admitted on **DATE[Mar 12 2007] , and found to have pneumonia as well as concurrent end - stage chronic obstructive pulmonary disease .
The patient was started on Pseudomonas for treatment of her right lower lobe pneumonia .
However , her hospital course was complicated by a GI bleed , requiring 12 units of PRBCs transfusion .
The patient continued to deteriorate throughout her hospital course and became weaker , and it was clear that her COPD was end stage .
Therefore , hospice was recommended , and the patient was transferred to hospice on **DATE[Mar 30 2007] , after full discussion with the patient 's family and medical staff and care providers .
Once transferred to hospice , the patient was managed on the principles of comfort measures only .
Her respiratory status continued to worsen , and her overall condition continued to deteriorate .
The patient was eventually placed on continuous IV infusion of morphine for comfort .
On **DATE[Mar 31 2007] , the nurse notified the **NAME[VVV] MD regarding the patient 's clinical condition .
Dr. **NAME[UUU] examined the patient at bedside , and findings were significant for no respiration , no pulse , and negative corneal reflex .
The patient ceased to breathe at 12:30 p.m. on **DATE[Mar 31 2007] , and her death certificate was signed and dated at that time .
______________________________
**NAME[WWW XXX]
HS Job # 370862 / 38636 / 38218
SHY # **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Apr 08 2007] 17:33
T :
